ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course.

History of Art 795 provided an introduction the sacred architecture of India from approx. the 9th c. AD to the present. In particular, the course focused on different scholarly approaches to these sacred spaces, ranging from ritual and performance studies to landscape architecture.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It contributed a ton, since I study ritual in India.

The course certainly deepened my knowledge of the field of South Asian architecture and ritual. I wonder if a syllabus that gave a more robust introduction to the scholarship on Indian temple architecture and sculpture (from throughout the 20th century) would have helped get us all off on the same footing; then, the approaches from ritual studies, performance studies etc could have been woven in as we got deeper into the subject.
